Information on contracts for the construction of Crossrail can be found on the Crossrail website .
We have awarded the contract to operate Crossrail services to MTR Corporation (Crossrail) Limited (MTR).

The contract is for eight years with an option to extend to ten years. The nominal value of concession payments payable to MTR over the base eight-year term is Â£1.4bn before performance adjustments (bonuses and penalties).
MTR will start running the services from 31 May 2015 between Liverpool Street and Shenfield, taking over the stopping services currently operated by Abellio Greater Anglia.

The contract for the provision of the rolling stock and depot for the Crossrail Project, the Rolling Stock and Depot Provision Agreement (RSPA), has been awarded by Transport for London (TfL) to Bombardier Transportation UK Ltd.
The Agreement will be managed by Rail for London Ltd (RfL) and covers the supply, delivery and maintenance of 65 new trains and the depot at Old Oak Common.
The documents comprising the Agreement are listed below. The file format is not suitable for online publication but they are available on request by emailing: foi@tfl.gov.uk .

Volumes 5, 6, 7, and 8 contain Schedule B2, the proposal from Bombardier Transportation in response to the Invitation to Tender. This schedule, together with certain information in the other volumes, is considered by RfL to comprise commercially confidential and proprietary information the disclosure of which is considered likely to prejudice the commercial interests of Bombardier Transportation and is exempt from disclosure in accordance with Section 43(2) of the Freedom of Information Act.
